results.title: Living with happiness
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt and Sarah Watt Productions
results.brief_description: A young mother finds herself gripped by an overwhelming pessimism that threatens to consume her. Only a freak accident on a lonely beach may be the key to her future happiness. Voices performed by Sigrid Thornton and William McInnes. (Awards: Winner, Emirates AFI Award for Best Animation, 2001)
results.description: A young mother finds herself gripped by an overwhelming pessimism that threatens to consume her. Only a freak accident on a lonely beach may be the key to her future happiness. results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: [Black Knight]
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of the British “Black Knight” rocket test vehicle and its use in high speed flight and ballistic missile research. The elements of construction, ground support equipment, propulsion, guidance and instrumentation are discussed. Tests and launching preparations at Australia’s Woomera Range follow, closing with a night-firing sequence. NB: No opening or closing credits

results.title: The Blue streak rocket
results.creator_credit: George Grafton Green and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Blue Streak Rocket is the first stage in the development of a rocket which will help boost a one ton satellite, of the European Launcher Development Organisation, into orbit three hundred miles high. Shows the static test in England and the launching at Woomera.
